Class GPMixtureModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • GPMixtureModel

  • public class GPMixtureModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic class for a univariate mixture model of a Gaussian and a Poisson distribution.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GPMixtureModel(double lambda, double mu, double sigma, double mixProp)
      Create new GPMixtureModel from the given parameters.

      • GPMixtureModel

        public GPMixtureModel(double lambda,
                      double mu,
                      double sigma,
                      double mixProp)
        Create new GPMixtureModel from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        lambda - expected value of the Poisson component.
        mu - expected value of the Gaussian component.
        sigma - standard deviation of the Gaussian component.
        mixProp - mixing proportions.

      • expectationMaximization

        public void expectationMaximization(SimpleVec vecData,
                                    double eps,
                                    int maxIter,
                                    float sampleProb,
                                    boolean verbose)
        Optimize model parameters for given data vector.

        This method uses the expectation maximization algorithm to optimize the set of parameters for the given data.

        Parameters:
        vecData - SimpleVec containing data points.
        eps - the algorithm terminates if the difference in log-likelihood between two iterations is below eps.
        maxIter - maximum number of iterations.
        sampleProb - percentage of data points used for every iteration.
        verbose - be verbose.

      • logLikelihood

        public double logLikelihood(SimpleVec vec)
        Compute the average log-likelihood for the current parameters under the given data.
        Parameters:
        vec - SimpleVec data vector.
        Returns:
        log-likelihood of current parameters (instance variables).
